Description: Tondo and foot sherd of Attic black-figured pottery short-stemmed cup; interior: black-figure decoration consisting of gorgoneion (right side of face including of hair with added red, eye and eyebrow, ear, part of mouth with beard, and fangs in added white remaining); red band and black area around tondo; exterior glazed black with red bands on waist and on top of foot; edge of foot reserved, inside glazed; underside reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA225 and British Museum 1886,0401.1160.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 437, no. B709)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0685) (Phase 1)
